citation.article-title: Psychrobacter proteolyticus sp. nov., a psychrotrophic, halotolerant bacterium isolated from the Antarctic krill Euphausia superba Dana, excreting a cold-adapted metalloprotease.

p.s: Description of Psychrobacter proteolyticus sp. nov.
Psychrobacter proteolyticus (pro.te.o.ly'ti.cus M.L. n. adj. proteolyticus, proteolytic)
Cells are Gram-negative, non-pigmented, non-motile, non-sporeforming, rod-shaped to coccoidal.
Cells are 0.5–1.25 μm wide x 1.0–2.5 μm long.
Colonies on complex standard media are cream colored, circular, entire, convex, and of butyrous consistence; diameter is up to 1.0 mm after 2 d incubation at room temperature.
Pigments are not produced.

The following biochemical tests are positive: oxidase, catalase, urease, alkaline phosphatase, C4 esterase, C8 esterase lipase, leucine arylamidase, valin arylamidase, acid phosphatase, and naphtol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.
Gelatin, casein and trybutrine are hydrolyzed, esculin, starch and DNA are not.

The following biochemical tests are negative: arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, C14 lipase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, H2S production, nitrate reduction, and indole production.
Citrate is utilised as single carbon source.
Acid is produced from carbohydrates: glucose, rhamnose, melibiose, amygdalin and arabinose.
No acid is produced from the carbohydrates: mannitol, inositol, sorbitol, and saccharose.
Phylogenetically, P. proteolyticus clusters with the validly published species of the genus Psychrobacter within the γ-subclass of the Proteobacteria (WOESE, 1987; STACKEBRANDT et al., 1988).
The G+C content of the DNA is 43.6 mol%.
Ubiquinone Q-8 is the main respiratory lipoquinone.
Phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol are the major polar lipids; several unknown lipids are present in minor concentrations as well.
The predominant nonpolar fatty acids are 18:1 cis 9 and 16:1 cis; 17:1 ω8c; 16:0, 18:0 and 12:0 are present in minor amounts.
The predominant 2-hydroxy fatty acid is 12:0 2-OH.
Significant trace amounts of 18:1 trans 9 cis 11, 17:0, 17:0 iso, 15:0 anteiso, 14:0 3-OH and 14:0 are present as well.

Source: strain 116 was isolated at the Arctowski Polish Antarctic station from a stomach specimen of the Antarctic krill Euphausia superba Dana caught in Admiralty Bay, King George Island, South Shetland Islands, Antarctica.
Strain 116 has been deposited in the Collection de I'Institut Pasteur, France, as CIP 106830T and in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen and Zellkulturen, as DSM 13887T.
